earthlyThingsList.name: Capybara
earthlyThingsList.description: The capybara is a giant cavy rodent native to South America; it is the largest living rodent.

earthlyThingsList.name: Stonehenge
earthlyThingsList.description: Prehistoric monument on Salisbury Plain in Wiltshire, England

earthlyThingsList.name: Burj Khalifa
earthlyThingsList.description: The Burj Khalifa is a mixed-use skyscraper located in Dubai, U.A.E., known for being the world's tallest building.

image.caption: Burj Khalifa towering over Dubai skyline

earthlyThingsList.name: Giraffe
earthlyThingsList.description: Giraffes are the tallest living terrestrial animal, and the largest ruminant on earth.

earthlyThingsList.name: Great Pyramid of Giza
earthlyThingsList.description: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the largest Egyptian pyramid and the tomb of Fourth Dynasty pharaoh Khufu.

image.caption: Ground level view of the great pyramid

earthlyThingsList.name: Taipei 101
earthlyThingsList.description: Building was officially classified as the world's tallest from its opening in 2004 until the 2009 completion of the Burj Khalifa in Dubai, UAE.

earthlyThingsList.name: Puma
earthlyThingsList.description: The puma is a large cat whose range spans from the Canadian Yukon to the southern Andes in South America; it is the most widespread of any large wild terrestrial mammal in the Western Hemisphere.
